definition: to return with thanks/to give back (honorific)
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
surname Huan
to pay back/to return

sentences.english: The National Institute of Culture praised the citizens who voluntarily returned the pieces.
sentences.chinese: 國家文化研究所表彰了那些自願奉還文物的公民。

sentences.english: We sent the goods arrived, and then the shortage will be refund.
sentences.chinese: 貨一到我們就會寄出，然後把餘額奉還。

sentences.english: If anyone kills Cain, Cain shall be avenged sevenfold.
sentences.chinese: 任何人如果殺了該隱，該隱可以七倍奉還。

sentences.english: Mental suffering, even if I was ten times your money back, I would also like to replace the bear.
sentences.chinese: 心靈上痛苦，即使十倍的奉還於我，我也想代替承受。

sentences.english: If the players want to make it hard for me, I'm happy to make it twice as hard for them.
sentences.chinese: 如果球員給我難堪，我將很高興的雙倍奉還給他們。

sentences.english: Did you know that when you help someone, the help will be returned in two folds?
sentences.chinese: 你知道嗎，你幫助別人，你的付出會雙倍奉還。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to write off at one stroke
taboo name (e.g. of emperor)
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
sensitive/tactful
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to bear grudges
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
silver money (in former times)
